title: 114_s2671
content: The Act titled "Advancing Medical Resident Training in Community Hospitals Act of 2016" allows Medicare GME treatment for hospitals starting new medical residency training programs after hosting medical resident rotators for short durations. The Act allows Medicare GME treatment for hospitals starting new medical residency training programs after hosting medical resident rotators for short durations. Amendments to Section 1886(h)(2)(F) of the Social Security Act include conditions for establishing FTE resident amounts for hospitals without GME affiliation agreements. The Act allows Medicare GME treatment for hospitals starting new medical residency training programs. The Secretary can establish a new FTE resident amount for hospitals without GME affiliation agreements. The Act allows Medicare GME treatment for hospitals starting new medical residency training programs by establishing new FTE resident limits. The Act allows Medicare GME treatment for hospitals starting new medical residency training programs by establishing new FTE resident limits. Hospitals can have a new adjustment in their resident limitation if they train at least 1.0 full-time equivalent resident. The Act allows Medicare GME treatment for hospitals starting new medical residency training programs by establishing new FTE resident limits. Hospitals can have an adjustment in their resident limitation if they train no more than 3.0 full-time equivalent residents in a new medical residency training program. The Act allows hospitals to adjust their resident limitation if they start training more than 3.0 full-time-equivalent residents in a new medical residency program. The amendments apply to payment under section 1886 of the Social Security Act for cost reporting periods beginning after the enactment of the Act.
